alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 20 at 10:27AM PDT until September 21 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM PDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY NORTHERLY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTH BAY INTERIOR MOUNTAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM PDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY NORTHERLY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTH BAY INTERIOR MOUNTAINS... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 504 North Bay Interior Mountains. * TIMING...11 PM Wednesday through 5 PM Thursday. * WINDS...North 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. Locally higher gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Tonight: Overnight recoveries of 40 to 60 percent. Thursday: Minimum relative humidity of 22 to 35 percent. * Highest Threat...Northern and eastern portions of Napa County that border the Sacramento Valley. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Northerly winds will be strongest between 11 pm tonight through 11 am Thursday, but breezy northerly winds will linger through the afternoon Thursday. Humidities will begin to drop late tonight into early morning hours. Low humidities in the 25 to 35 percent range are expected by Thursday morning.
